articles.author: Keith Ballinger
articles.description: Over the past few weeks, we have experienced multiple incidents due to the health of our database. We wanted to share what we know about these incidents while our team continues to address them.
articles.title: An update on recent service disruptions

articles.author: Jennifer Schelkopf
articles.description: You can now enforce consistent usage of self-hosted runner groups across your organization and enterprise.
articles.title: GitHub Actions: secure self-hosted runners by limiting them to specific workflows

articles.author: Bruce Williams
articles.description: Today, we are rolling out a new beta version of GitHub’s home feed, making it easier to discover projects, developers and more across GitHub.
articles.title: Improving your GitHub feed

articles.author: Matt Cooper
articles.description: If you're a GHES customer with heavy read traffic on your monorepo, check out the repository cache, especially if you have CI workloads distributed around the world.
articles.title: Introducing the GHES repository cache

articles.author: Daniel Adams
articles.description: You can now create a branch to work on an issue directly from the issue page so that it's easier to get started right away.
articles.title: Start working on GitHub Issues faster

articles.author: Jaroslav Lobacevski
articles.description: If there's one habit that can make software more secure, it's probably input validation. Here's how to apply OWASP Proactive Control C5 (Validate All Inputs) to your code.
articles.title: Validate all the things: improve your security with input validation!

articles.author: Michelle Mannering
articles.description: Our community has shipped lots of open source project updates in the last month. Here's a few of our staff picks.
articles.title: Release Radar · February 2022 Edition

articles.author: Cameron Booth
articles.description: It is now possible to re-run only failed jobs or a single job in GitHub Actions workflows.
articles.title: Save time with partial re-runs in GitHub Actions

articles.author: Melody Mileski
articles.description: We've introduced several new features to help enterprise owners more easily manage their accounts, including two features now in public beta.
articles.title: Improved management for GitHub Enterprise owners

articles.author: Jakub Oleksy
articles.description: In February, we experienced one incident resulting in significant impact to multiple GitHub services.
articles.title: GitHub Availability Report: February 2022

articles.author: Daniel Rosenwasser
articles.description:
Today we’re excited to announce our support and collaboration on a new Stage 0 proposal to bring optional and erasable type syntax to JavaScript.
The post A Proposal For Type Syntax in JavaScript appeared first on TypeScript.
articles.title: A Proposal For Type Syntax in JavaScript

articles.author: Daniel Rosenwasser
articles.description:
Today we’re announcing the availability of TypeScript 4.6.
The post Announcing TypeScript 4.6 appeared first on TypeScript.
articles.title: Announcing TypeScript 4.6
